page.title: 10Money Hill Farm
page.content: Money Hill farm is situated by the River Mease at the south end of our block.It covers 165 acres which are maintained by one family.The farm is arable whilst also supporting a stock of cattle. A system of rotation farming is followed on 112 acres of the land.At present this is divided into 38 acres of wheat,60 acres of barley and 14 acres of oats.The remaining 53 acres are grassland which supports 145 herefords,32 of which are bulls ,30 hiring bulls, 40 cows, 30 calves and 13 yearlings. A farm of this size has the machinery necessary for its smooth running:- 3 tractors,combine harvester,baler,sprayer,trailors, plough,harrow,cattle lorry. Jobs around the farm are seasonal, but each day always begins early.
